author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Election Commission has disqualified for three years 42 candidates from the State, who had contested in the Assembly and Parliamentary polls in 2011 and 2014 respectively, for not filing their expenditure details with the Commission.

Ten candidates had contested the Assembly polls in 2011 and the others the Parliamentary polls in 2014. All of them are independent candidates, Chief Electoral Officer Rajesh Lakhoni said.

The Arakkonam and Vellore Parliamentary constituencies saw 10 candidates’ disqualification. Six candidates from Ramanathapuram, four from Kancheepuram and two candidates from Sriperumbudur Parliamentary constituencies were also in the list.

As for those who contested in the 2011 Assembly polls, three from Kinathukadavu, two from Pollachi and one each from Mettupalayam, Sulur, Kavundampalayam, Coimbatore (South) and Singanallur Assembly constituencies were also disqualified.

Meanwhile, the EC has approved over 30,000 EVM ballot units for the State.
title: EC disqualifies 42 candidates
